column4: hi guys, how can i install MythTV cuz I have Skystar2 DVB card
sudo apt-get install mythtv
see the walkthroughs from ubottu
sudo apt-get install libc
the terminal says can't find package libc!
can we get a pastebin of the output about libc missing?
is there a hidden file in ~/ named .vlc
the router you buy doesnt matter as they all adhere to the ISO standards, its only the device in your system you have to worry about
as long as your OS can interact with your wireless in your systems then they will interfcae with ANY router you buy

This is my first time for me with ADSL I haven't installed the ADSL sevice so i don't know who to set it up. As i understood from you, that i only have to put the telephone line inside the LinkSys wireless mode (router) and then my desktop that has a D-Link wireless card will take internet from the router, right?
I still use Dial-u
you may have to configure an account with may require a windows system, if the account is premade you can apply your settings to the router and it will connect
so I don't have to connect the router with the PC?
What account?

it varies with providers, if you have to setup an account then they will assume windows and you may have to use a windows system to setup the initial account. But as the connection between linux and the router you can use anything at all
when you get adsl yu buy an acount and an IP address, this will need aplying to your router of choice
ive told you before, yuo MAY have to. It depends on the provider
that's right, in my country when we buy ADSL they give us username and password and phone number to connect. So where to put these, in Windows?
no, you put those in your router
aha, and to put these configurations in my router i might need windows. Right?
cuz the router software might only support windows?
no, the account setup software may be windows only
the router itself and configuring it will be done via a web browser so will be doable from ANY system
